Posts.Content: Mar 18, 2010 06:27AM Iluvn02 wrote: Hi, Patti~ I've been on Femara since early Nov. 2009 and noticed that I am a bit more sinus "headachier" at times, which is probably one of the side effects.  I also get monthly Zometa infusions, which might also be contributing to the "headaches".  Other than that, no other sinus issues, but that could change as it gets to be into summer as I have summer allergies. What have you been experiencing? Lori

Posts.Title: Officially "living life with zest" & NED's along for the ride! Linnette1217 vickib

Posts.Content: May 8, 2010 09:44PM Iluvn02 wrote: I've been on Femara for 6 months and have new things in the way of SE's almost every day.  Initially, I was experiencing lightheadedness and fatigue but not really a lot of joint pain and stiffness, probably due to the fact that I exercise quite vigorously 5 days a week.  As time has gone on however (within the last month or so), I have developed a trigger thumb, and my fingers are getting stiffer in the morning more than ever.  I keep telling myself it's because I'm getting older (I'm in my 60's), but my Onc says it's the Femara.  Last week I went to an exercise class (core strengthening) I've been going to for at least a year and although I've occasionally felt a bit stiff afterward, I havent been able to move in the mornings and my lower back has hurt for the last 3 days.  Advil has helped a lot and as the day goes on everything feels better, but I know it will be bad again in the morning.  I just hope it doesn't last. I just hope this isn't going to be the end of my being able to exercise as it's been one of the things that has kept me "sane" in this crazy battle we're fighting on a daily basis.  I also get very weepy from time to time. The only good things I can say about the drug are my tumor markers have gone to 24 from 51 intially, and my most recent bone scan was "stable" as I had mets in my right hip. Also, I initally had mets in the orbit of my eye, which were the first mets to clear up.  I also get a monthly infusion of Zometa... haven't had any other teatments so far and it seems the Zometa is keeping the bone mets from progressing. Even though the SE's of Femara are tough, I guess I should be happy it's keeping the cancer at bay for now.  What would we do without this website and all of the wonderful people who post.  I know it has helped me tremendously.  Thanks to all.
Posts.Title: Now I'm Getting Worried lukejessesmom Iluvn02
